title: Google\Cloud\Spanner\V1\Type
name: Type
description:
Type indicates the type of a Cloud Spanner value, as might be stored in a table cell or returned from an SQL query.

Generated from protobuf message google.spanner.v1.Type

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.array_element_type
params.description: If [code][google.spanner.v1.Type.code] == [ARRAY][google.spanner.v1.TypeCode.ARRAY], then array_element_type is the type of the array elements.

params.name: data.struct_type
params.description: If [code][google.spanner.v1.Type.code] == [STRUCT][google.spanner.v1.TypeCode.STRUCT], then struct_type provides type information for the struct's fields.

params.name: data.type_annotation
params.description: The [TypeAnnotationCode][google.spanner.v1.TypeAnnotationCode] that disambiguates SQL type that Spanner will use to represent values of this type during query processing. This is necessary for some type codes because a single [TypeCode][google.spanner.v1.TypeCode] can be mapped to different SQL types depending on the SQL dialect. [type_annotation][google.spanner.v1.Type.type_annotation] typically is not needed to process the content of a value (it doesn't affect serialization) and clients can ignore it on the read path.

This is necessary for some type codes because a single [TypeCode][google.spanner.v1.TypeCode] can be mapped to different SQL types depending on the SQL dialect.
